block.p: Kyra Rachel Darnton, a daughter of Nina and John Darnton of Manhattan, is to be married this evening to David Elliot Grann, a son of Phyllis Grann and Dr. Victor Grann of Manhattan. Rabbi Balfour Brickner is to officiate in Riverdale, the Bronx.

The bride, 29, is an associate producer in Manhattan for the CBS news program ''60 Minutes II.'' She graduated from Duke University. Her father is the culture editor of The New York Times and the author of two novels, ''Neanderthal'' (Random House, 1996) and ''The Experiment'' (Dutton, 1999). Her mother is a freelance magazine writer.

The bride, 29, is an associate producer in Manhattan for the CBS news program ''60 Minutes II.'' She graduated from Duke University. Her father is the culture editor of The New York Times and the author of two novels, ''Neanderthal'' (Random House, 1996) and ''The Experiment'' (Dutton, 1999). Her mother is a freelance magazine writer.

The bridegroom, 33, is a senior editor and writer in Manhattan for The New Republic. A graduate of Connecticut College, he received master's degrees in international relations from the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy at Tufts University and in literature from Boston University.

His mother is the president and chief executive of Penguin Putnam, the publishing company, in Manhattan. His father, an oncologist, is an associate clinical professor of medicine and of public health at Columbia University in Manhattan.
